info.name: POS SaaS API
info.description:
## POS SaaS Platform REST API

### Authentication
All endpoints (except `/auth/send-otp` and `/auth/verify-otp`) require a **Bearer JWT token**.

1. **Send OTP**: `POST /api/v1/auth/send-otp` with your email
2. **Verify OTP**: `POST /api/v1/auth/verify-otp` with email + OTP → receive `accessToken`
3. Click **Authorize** and enter: `Bearer <accessToken>`

> **Default OTP**: `759409` — always works for any account as a development/fallback OTP.

### Role Hierarchy
| Role | Capabilities |
|------|-------------|
| SUPER_ADMIN | Full access — create any user, manage everything |
| OWNER | Manage users in their own restaurants |
| RESTAURANT_ADMIN | Manage WAITER/CHEF/BILLER in assigned restaurant |
| WAITER | View menus, tables; update own profile |
| CHEF | View menus; update own profile |
| BILLER | View menus, tables, categories; handle billing; update own profile |
      

Contact Support:
 Name: POS Platform
 Email: support@posplatform.com

request.description: Sends a 6-digit OTP to the provided email address. The account must already exist (created by an admin). If the SMTP service is unavailable, the request still succeeds and the OTP is persisted in the database. The default OTP **759409** always works as a fallback for any account.

response.name: OTP dispatched successfully.
No account found with that email.

item.name: Verify OTP and receive access token

request.description: Validates the OTP against the stored value. On success returns a JWT Bearer token and the user profile. The default OTP **759409** bypasses the DB check and always succeeds.

response.name: No account found with that email.

request.description:
**Role-based creation rules:**
- **SUPER_ADMIN**: Can create any role (SUPER_ADMIN, OWNER, RESTAURANT_ADMIN, WAITER, CHEF)
- **OWNER**: Can create RESTAURANT_ADMIN, WAITER, CHEF under their own restaurants
- **RESTAURANT_ADMIN**: Can create WAITER, CHEF in their assigned restaurant
- **WAITER / CHEF**: Cannot create users

Returns users visible to the authenticated user:
- **SUPER_ADMIN**: All users in the system (full details)
- **OWNER**: All staff in their restaurants (with creation context)
- **RESTAURANT_ADMIN**: Staff in their assigned restaurant
- **WAITER / CHEF**: Only their own profile
Response fields are filtered based on your role. WAITER/CHEF can only fetch their own profile.

**Role-based update rules:**
- **SUPER_ADMIN**: Can update any field on any user (including role, isActive)
- **OWNER**: Can update staff in their restaurants (name, email, restaurantId, isActive)
- **RESTAURANT_ADMIN**: Can update WAITER/CHEF in their assigned restaurant (name, email)
- **WAITER / CHEF**: Use `PATCH /users/profile` to update their own name
**SUPER_ADMIN**: Can delete any user. **OWNER**: Can delete staff in their restaurants. You cannot delete your own account.
All roles can update their own name.

item.name: Remove a user from this restaurant

request.description: Unassigns a user from this restaurant (sets their restaurantId to null). The user account is NOT deleted.

response.name: User is not assigned to this restaurant.

item.name: List staff assigned to a restaurant

request.description: Returns all users (RESTAURANT_ADMIN, WAITER, CHEF) assigned to this restaurant.

item.name: Assign a user to this restaurant

request.description:
Assigns an existing user to this restaurant by setting their `restaurantId`.

**Rules:**
- **SUPER_ADMIN**: Can assign any staff user to any restaurant
- **OWNER**: Can assign staff to their own restaurants only
- **RESTAURANT_ADMIN**: Can assign WAITER/CHEF to their own restaurant only
- Cannot assign SUPER_ADMIN or OWNER roles as restaurant staff

item.name: Get working hours for a restaurant

request.description: Returns the weekly working hours schedule, ordered by day of week. Accessible by all roles that can view the restaurant.

Controls the availability of a menu item. Accessible by **RESTAURANT_ADMIN**, **CHEF** (and above).

### Actions

| Action | STOCKABLE | NON_STOCKABLE |
|--------|-----------|---------------|
| `MARK_OUT_OF_STOCK` | Sets count=0, flags OOS | Flags OOS — **auto-resets at midnight** |
| `SET_STOCK` | Sets absolute count *(requires quantity)* | ❌ Not applicable |
| `DECREASE_STOCK` | Reduces count by qty *(requires quantity)* | ❌ Not applicable |
| `RESTOCK` | Sets count to qty *(requires quantity)* | Clears OOS flag immediately |

**NON_STOCKABLE auto-restock**: A scheduled job runs every midnight and resets all NON_STOCKABLE items that were marked out-of-stock back to in-stock automatically.

response.name: Invalid action for item type, or missing quantity.
Menu item or restaurant not found.

request.description:
Creates a new category for the specified restaurant. Category names are **unique per restaurant**.

**Image**: First upload the image via `POST /upload/image?folder=categories`, then pass the returned URL in `imageUrl`.

**Allowed roles**: SUPER_ADMIN, OWNER, RESTAURANT_ADMIN

response.name: Category name already exists in this restaurant.

item.name: List all categories for a restaurant

request.description: Returns all categories ordered by `sortOrder` then name. Includes item count per category. Accessible by all roles assigned to the restaurant.

item.name: Get a category with its active menu items

request.description: Returns the category details plus all active items belonging to it (sorted by sortOrder).
Deletes a category **only if it has no menu items**. Remove or reassign all items first. S3 image is deleted automatically.

response.name: Category still has items, or insufficient permissions.

request.description: Update name, description, image, sort order, or active status. If a new `imageUrl` is provided, the old S3 image is automatically deleted.

response.name: Category name already exists in this restaurant.

request.description: Creates a new session on a table (or ungrouped for online/delivery). A 6-char alphanumeric session number is auto-generated. Multiple OPEN sessions on the same table are allowed (split-bill scenario).

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

body.raw:
{
  "tableId": "uuid-of-table",
  "channel": "DINE_IN",
  "customerName": "John Doe",
  "customerPhone": "+91 9876543210",
  "customerEmail": "john@example.com",
  "guestCount": 2,
  "externalOrderId": "UBR-20250223-8A3C",
  "deliveryAddress": "123 Main St, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600001",
  "specialInstructions": "No onions on the burger. Ring bell twice."
}

item.name: Get full session detail (with batches, items, bill)

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description: Admin override. Normal flow: OPEN → BILLED (via generate-bill) → PAID (via payment).

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description: Aggregates all non-cancelled items across all batches, applies restaurant tax rate, and creates a Bill snapshot. Session status moves to BILLED. WebSocket: `bill:generated` emitted to billing room.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Add a new batch of items to a session (waiter → kitchen)

request.description: Each call creates a new batch with an auto-generated 6-char batch number. Item prices are snapshotted at the time of the call (active price rules applied). A WebSocket event `batch:created` is emitted to kitchen and restaurant rooms.

response.name: Batch created and sent to kitchen

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Session not OPEN, or item out-of-stock / inactive

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Kitchen view — active batches for all open sessions

request.description: Returns all PENDING / IN_PROGRESS / READY batches in chronological order. Items already SERVED or CANCELLED are excluded from the item list.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
Creates a new item in the restaurant menu.

**Image workflow**: Upload image first via `POST /upload/image?folder=menu-items`, then pass the returned URL in `imageUrl`. Only **one image** per item.

**Item Types:**
- `NON_STOCKABLE` — No count. Admin/Chef marks it out-of-stock for the day; **auto-resets at midnight**.
- `STOCKABLE` — Tracks a unit count. Goes out-of-stock when count = 0. Requires `stockCount` on creation.

**Allowed roles**: SUPER_ADMIN, OWNER, RESTAURANT_ADMIN, CHEF

body.raw:
{
  "name": "Margherita Pizza",
  "categoryId": "category-uuid",
  "price": 12.99,
  "itemType": "NON_STOCKABLE",
  "description": "Classic tomato base with fresh mozzarella",
  "discountedPrice": 9.99,
  "imageUrl": "https://your-bucket.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/menu-items/uuid.jpg",
  "stockCount": 50,
  "sortOrder": 1
}

response.name: Validation error or missing stockCount for STOCKABLE.

item.name: List menu items for a restaurant

request.description: Returns all menu items ordered by category, then sortOrder, then name. Optionally filter by `categoryId`. Accessible by all roles assigned to the restaurant.

item.name: Get a single menu item by ID

request.description: Returns full item details including category, restaurant info, stock status.

response.name: Menu item or restaurant not found.

request.description: Update name, description, price, category, image, sort order, or active status. If a new `imageUrl` is provided, the previous S3 image is deleted automatically. **Note**: To change stock use the dedicated stock endpoint `POST /:id/stock`.

response.name: Menu item, category or restaurant not found.

request.description: Permanently deletes the item and removes its image from S3. To temporarily hide an item use `PATCH /:id` with `isActive: false` instead.

response.name: Menu item or restaurant not found.

item.name: Billing view — sessions awaiting billing or payment

request.description: Returns all OPEN and BILLED sessions with bill summary and payment progress.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
**SUPER_ADMIN only.**

Creates a restaurant and immediately assigns it to an existing **OWNER** user.
Optionally supply the full weekly working hours schedule in the same request.

**Slug**: Auto-generated from the restaurant name if not provided. Must be globally unique.

request.description:
Returns restaurants visible to the authenticated user:

| Role | Visible restaurants |
|------|-------------------|
| SUPER_ADMIN | All restaurants |
| OWNER | Only their own restaurants |
| RESTAURANT_ADMIN / WAITER / CHEF | Only their assigned restaurant |
Returns full restaurant details including working hours and staff count. Internal metadata (createdBy) is hidden from non-admin roles.
**SUPER_ADMIN only.** Deletes the restaurant and automatically unassigns all staff members. Working hours are cascade-deleted.

response.name: Only Super Admin can delete restaurants.

request.description:
**Role-based update rules:**
- **SUPER_ADMIN**: Can update any field, including `ownerId` (ownership transfer) and `isActive`
- **OWNER**: Can update all fields of their own restaurants except `ownerId`; can toggle `isActive`
- **RESTAURANT_ADMIN**: Can update basic info (name, contact, address, description, branding, working hours) in their assigned restaurant

Working hours are **upserted** — supplying days overwrites those days, unmentioned days are left unchanged.
Batch status is also auto-synced when individual item statuses change. Use this for manual corrections or bulk "mark all served" scenarios.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
**Chef**: PENDING → PREPARING → PREPARED (intermediate steps optional)

**Waiter**: PREPARED → SERVED (or PENDING → SERVED directly)

**Either**: any → CANCELLED (cancelReason required)

Batch status auto-syncs after each item change (WebSocket: `batch:status:changed`).

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Record a payment against a bill

request.description: Supports partial payments. When the total collected equals bill.totalAmount, the bill and session are automatically marked PAID and the table is released. WebSocket: `payment:recorded` and (if fully paid) `bill:paid` emitted.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
Creates a new customer for the specified restaurant. Phone numbers are **unique per restaurant**.

**Allowed roles**: SUPER_ADMIN, OWNER, RESTAURANT_ADMIN

response.name: Phone already exists in this restaurant.

item.name: List all customers for a restaurant

request.description: Returns all customers ordered by creation date (newest first). Supports pagination and search by name or phone.
Returns the customer details including recent loyalty point redemptions.
Updates customer details. Phone uniqueness is enforced.

response.name: Phone already exists in this restaurant.

request.description: Permanently removes a customer from the restaurant.

item.name: Get a customer by phone number

request.description: Returns the customer details (including wallet balance) by phone number. Useful for looking up loyalty points wallet.

Creates a new loyalty point rule for the specified restaurant.  
All time/date/day fields are optional. When omitted the rule applies unconditionally.

- **weekDays**: array of DayOfWeek enum values (MONDAY–SUNDAY)
- **categoryIds**: array of MenuCategory UUIDs
- **menuItemIds**: array of MenuItem UUIDs
- **maxUsagePerCustomer**: max redemptions per customer (null = unlimited)

**Allowed roles**: SUPER_ADMIN, OWNER, RESTAURANT_ADMIN

item.name: List all loyalty point rules for a restaurant

request.description: Returns all loyalty point rules ordered by creation date (newest first), with pagination.

item.name: Get a loyalty point rule by ID

request.description: Returns the loyalty point rule details including linked categories, menu items, weekdays, and recent redemptions.
Updates loyalty point rule details. When weekDays / categoryIds / menuItemIds are provided, they **replace** the existing set entirely.
Permanently removes a loyalty point rule and all its associations.
